body:
I strongly do not want to expose type tags of IValue as a public interface. It prevents future optimizations to the representation of the tags internally to the IValue. For instance, if we go to nan-boxing of 8-byte values then it is significantly easier to check `isTensor()` than to ask "of all the types what type is it?" Exposing the tags will encourage people to write `kind() == Tensor` and prevent future optimizations.

I don't thing anything in this PR actually requires this change. The `kind` field in ArgumentInfo change be change to an `is_tensor` field.

For instance, if we go to nan-boxing of 8-byte values then it is significantly easier to check isTensor() than to ask "of all the types what type is it?" Exposing the tags will encourage people to write kind() == Tensor and prevent future optimizations.

I don't thing anything in this PR actually requires this change. The kind field in ArgumentInfo change be change to an is_tensor field.
body_text:
I strongly do not want to expose type tags of IValue as a public interface. It prevents future optimizations to the representation of the tags internally to the IValue. For instance, if we go to nan-boxing of 8-byte values then it is significantly easier to check isTensor() than to ask "of all the types what type is it?" Exposing the tags will encourage people to write kind() == Tensor and prevent future optimizations.
I don't thing anything in this PR actually requires this change. The kind field in ArgumentInfo change be change to an is_tensor field.
